oai_dc:dc.dc:contributor: The New Digital Bleek and Lloyd
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: |han=kass'o (Klein Jantje) (VIII)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The children call the lion different names by day and by night and wish to avoid insulting (or slighting it). 1) See also The lion has the power of turning itself into other things and A wild cat, when many have been killed by a person changes itself into a lion and kills the slayer, 2) This story is found in Book VIII-23.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd |xam notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Children do not say the lion's name at night
